Description: Bone doll; carved from animal-bone; represents the head of a female figure, perforated ears for separate earrings (now missing); flat top with traces of green pigment or copper corrosion and dark infilling to the eyes and eyebrows which probably represents traces of pigment.
Curator's comments: On dolls of this type: A. Shatil, "Bone Figurines of the Early Islamic Period: The So Called 'Coptic Dolls' from Palestine and Egypt", in: S. Vitezović, ed. Close to the Bone: Current Studies in Bone Technologies (Belgrade 2016) 296-314.
